[h2]Oldie but goldie[/h2]
It‚Äôs the end of 2025 and this game is still fantastic. Don‚Äôt be misled by comments about [b]EA‚Äôs servers - they‚Äôre still running[/b], and you can easily compete with others on the leaderboards. The best proof is the fact that [b]more people are playing Dirt Rally 2.0 than EA WRC[/b]. There‚Äôs plenty of content here to enjoy for dozens of hours. Historical challenges, career mode, and the rallycross career all offer a lot of fun (although I‚Äôm not a fan of how the difficulty scales in rallycross - when you‚Äôre racing with the AI in your lobby they drive calmly, but outside of it you get much faster times that are hard to compete with).
Grab Dirt Rally 2.0 GOTY Edition on sale and you won‚Äôt be disappointed.

I haven't driven a rally car (yet), so I'm not sure exactly how realistic some aspects of the handling are, but driving with a basic Logitech G29 in this game feels really nice. My favorite car to drive in this game as of writing this review would probably be the 1998 Subaru Impreza S4. My favorite rallies in no particular order are New England, Finland, and Sweden; though I enjoy all of them in their own ways.

I wish that this game had longer stages and maybe some more variety. The longest stage is, if I remember correctly, about 10 miles (16km) and there's basically only two tracks per location with each of those is split into 6 stages: forwards and backwards for the full length of track, then split in half and the halves being forwards and backwards. Of course, it's still plenty to keep you busy for a while.

This is, by far, the most exceptionally difficult / impossible racing video game I've ever had the misfortune of playing. If it were possible to rate the playibility of this game with negative stars, I would give it a -5. When attempting to complete any race, even on easy mode, the announcer gives incorrect instructions on which direction to turn about 60% of the time. So, you can't compensate for this immense flaw by turning the opposite direction of what they tell you, because it's right almost half of the time, but wrong the majority of the time. For example, it will tell you there is a left turn coming up, when that is incorrect, it's a right turn. Totally and completely unplayable, even on easy mode, for me.  Strongly regret purchasing this game.

This is, by far, the most exceptionally difficult / impossible racing video game I've ever had the misfortune of playing. If it were possible to rate the playibility of this game with negative stars, I would give it a -5. When attempting to complete any race, even on easy mode, the announcer gives incorrect instructions on which direction to turn about 60% of the time. So, you can't compensate for this immense flaw by turning the opposite direction of what they tell you, because it's right almost half of the time, but wrong the majority of the time. For example, it will tell you there is a left turn coming up, when that is incorrect, it's a right turn. Totally and completely unplayable, even on easy mode, for me.  Strongly regret purchasing this game.
